channel.title: Could an persistent Kicksecure .img be made using TailsOS live USB?
channel.description:
could an persistent Kicksecure .img be made using TailsOS live USB? How about
on a Pi? is it more desirable to do this using debian on a persistent disk?

item.title: Could an persistent Kicksecure .img be made using TailsOS live USB?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
xianhua:

could an persistent Kicksecure .img be made using TailsOS live USB?

In theory, yes.
In practice, won’t happen.
Please don’t ask for technical details as it will lead nowhere.

Read full topic
item.source: Could an persistent Kicksecure .img be made using TailsOS live USB?
